newsitem.title: USA: Disney withdrew obscenity-laced rock album.
newsitem.headline: Disney withdrew obscenity-laced rock album.

text.p: The Walt Disney Co. pulled about 100,000 copies of an obscenity-laced rap album only six hours after releasing it to stores.
The company declined to comment whether the move on Tuesday was prompted by a recently launched boycott by Southern Baptists to protest what they called Disney's tolerance of gay lifestyles.
The album, "The Great Milenko" by the band Insane Clown Posse, was released and recalled Tuesday.

"When the lyrics of Insane Clown Posse album were brought to the attention of senior management, the decision was made that they were inappropriate for a product released under any label of our company," Disney's Hollywood Records said in a statement.
"Unfortunately, our internal review process did not initially flag the album and allowed it to proceed," the statement said.
